headline.print_headline: Unease at Clinton Foundation Over Finances and Ambitions
headline.main: Unease at Clinton Foundation Over Finances and Ambitions

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and AMY CHOZICK
byline.contributor: Lydia Polgreen contributed reporting, and Kitty Bennett contributed research.

docs.abstract: Clinton Foundation, domain of Bill Clinton since its formation in 2001, will become the nerve center of Hillary Rodham Clinton's increasingly busy public life; Clinton and her staff will move into offices at foundation’s new headquarters in Midtown Manhattan, further intertwining the family's political, philanthropic and business ventures.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the coming weeks the Clinton Foundation, long Bill Clinton’s domain, will become the nerve center of Hillary Rodham Clinton’s increasingly busy public life.
docs.snippet: In the coming weeks the Clinton Foundation, long Bill Clinton’s domain, will become the nerve center of Hillary Rodham Clinton’s increasingly busy public life.

headline.print_headline: Music Stars Join First Lady To Get Youths Off the Couch
headline.main: Music Stars Join First Lady to Get Youths Off the Couch

docs.abstract: Several hip-hop artists are volunteering to contribute songs to an album inspired by Michelle Obama's work fighting childhood obesity.
docs.lead_paragraph: With a new album full of songs focused on exercise and healthy eating, hip-hop artists enlist in Michelle Obama’s battle against childhood obesity.
docs.snippet: With a new album full of songs focused on exercise and healthy eating, hip-hop artists enlist in Michelle Obama’s battle against childhood obesity.

headline.print_headline: Music Stars Join First Lady To Get Youths Off the Couch
headline.main: Music Stars Join First Lady to Get Youths Off the Couch

docs.abstract: Hip-hop artists are volunteering for Michelle Obama’s “Let’s Move!” campaign with an album inspired by her work fighting childhood obesity.
docs.snippet: Hip-hop artists are volunteering for Michelle Obama’s “Let’s Move!” campaign with an album inspired by her work fighting childhood obesity.

docs.abstract: A college reunion, approached with slight dread, proves to be more warm and affectionate than grisly and sad.
docs.snippet: A college reunion, approached with slight dread, proves to be more warm and affectionate than grisly and sad.

docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column contends that Americans have more to fear from a tattered social fabric than from a suffocatingly tight one; sides with those arguing for a modest governmental paternalism that could force Americans to choose what is good for them.
docs.lead_paragraph: Considering how mentally lazy most of us are, a little soft paternalism that forces us to choose what’s good for us is probably just what we all need.
docs.snippet: Considering how mentally lazy most of us are, a little soft paternalism that forces us to choose what’s good for us is probably just what we all need.
